page.title: 04BROCKET HALL - PART THREE
page.content: When Lord Melbourne died in 1848 the Brocket Estate which Queen Victoria had so admired was neglected and run down. However William's sister, Emily, who had married Earl Cowper and lived nearby at Panshanger, had always liked Brocket Hall and was deeply attached to it. In 1837 Emily's first husband had died and in 1839 she was married again, to Henry John Temple, Lord Palmerston, Foreign Secretary and later Prime Minster. Lord and Lady Palmerston stayed often at Brocket Hall where it is reported he liked playing billiards and shooting pheasants, even after he became Prime Minister. This occurred first in 1855 then on the 30th June, 1859, Lord Palmerston became Prime Minister for the second time, and remained so until he was over eighty years of age.
